00.title: Basic Setup Requirement
00.description:
**PREREQUISITE:** Before any tests can pass, the payroll system must be properly compiled and running.

The current situation with the payroll calculator is quite challenging. The payroll vendor responsible for managing and maintaining the payroll system has unexpectedly gone out of business, leaving their team unavailable for any support or assistance.

This sudden disruption has caused significant issues, as the payroll was pre-generated and distributed into checks by various departments. Unfortunately, these departments have started flagging numerous issues with the payroll calculations, indicating potential errors that need immediate attention.

**Your first task:** Successfully compile and run the payroll calculator using the provided source code and input data files. This is essential before you can begin addressing the specific issues reported by the departments.

**Note:** This is not a separate test case, but a fundamental requirement for all other tasks to function.

01.title: Missing Payroll Record
01.subject: Urgent Payroll Issue for User ID 24778715
01.description:
We are writing to formally raise a complaint regarding a critical payroll issue identified in the reconciliation report for the DB payroll department. It has come to our attention that there is no payroll record generated for a specific user.

This discrepancy, if not addressed immediately, will result in the user not receiving their due payment. The absence of a payroll record for this user is a matter of urgent concern. Failure to resolve this issue promptly could lead to a negative experience for the user and expose the organization to potential legal action.

**Action Required:** Please investigate and rectify this issue as a matter of priority. We request immediate attention and resolution to ensure the user receives their payment without further delay.

02.title: Duplicate Salary Payment
02.description:
**Employee received his salary twice.**

An employee received his salary twice for one month. Please urgently check why it happened and fix the issue.

Our operation team has fixed it and the duplicated transaction was cancelled, but we don't want this to happen again.

This indicates there's a bug in the payroll system that's causing duplicate payments to be generated for certain employees. The system should ensure each employee receives exactly one payment per period.

03.title: Missing Overtime Payment
03.subject: Overtime for Previous Month
03.description:
Dear Payroll Calculator Support Team,

I hope this message finds you well.

I am writing to bring to your attention an issue regarding my overtime payment for the month of April. Despite having logged the overtime hours as required, I have not received the corresponding payment.

Could you please investigate this matter and ensure that the payment is processed at the earliest convenience? I have attached the relevant timesheets for your reference.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your swift resolution.

Best regards,
Franz Josef Hartmann

04.title: Tax Class Handling Implementation
04.subject: Add Support for Tax Class Handling in Payroll Calculations
04.description: As part of enhancing the Payroll Calculator, we need to introduce support for handling employee tax classes. The tax class should influence the calculation of payroll deductions and net salary. This change ensures better accuracy and compliance with German payroll requirements.

scope: Accept tax class as input per employee
Map tax class to corresponding tax rate
Apply rate during payroll calculations to determine tax deductions
Ensure compatibility with existing calculations and outputs

05.title: Fix Salary Proration Based on Working Days
05.subject: Fix Payroll Calculation to Accurately Prorate Based on Days Worked per Month
05.description:
The current implementation of the Payroll Calculator does not properly account for the number of days worked in relation to the total number of working days in a given month. This leads to incorrect salary proration, especially in cases where employees join, leave, or take unpaid leave during the month.

These discrepancies frequently result in complaints from employees, which have to be manually investigated and corrected by payroll staff. This not only consumes significant administrative time but also negatively impacts employee trust and satisfaction with the payroll process.

Addressing this issue will ensure that the calculator determines the correct number of working days in each month (excluding weekends and public holidays where applicable) and uses this to prorate salary and deductions accurately.

**Expected Impact:** Fixing this would reduce the number of manual corrections required, saving approximately 15 minutes per case. With an estimated 30â€“40 such cases per payroll cycle, this change could save up to 10 hours per month for the payroll team. More importantly, it would also save employees time and frustration, helping maintain trust and morale by ensuring their compensation is calculated fairly the first time.

06.title: Remove Terminated Employee
06.subject: Persons who already are not working with us got salary
06.description:
The salary calculator prepared the salary transaction for individuals who are not working with us anymore. Please, check and fix the issue.

**Example:** Former employee still receiving payments

This indicates that the payroll system is not properly filtering out terminated employees from payroll processing. The system should only process payments for currently active employees.

07.title: Incorrect Overtime Calculation
07.subject: 12 hours overtime didn't get what expected
07.description:
Dear Payroll Calculator Support team,

I hope this message finds you well. My name is Juergen Trub, and I am writing to bring to your attention a discrepancy in my recent billing statement regarding overtime payments.

On May 5th, I worked an additional **12 hours** due to an incident in production. However, upon reviewing my current billing statement, I noticed that the overtime payments are less than expected. This discrepancy is causing me significant concern and frustration.

I kindly request that you recalculate my payment for the overtime hours worked and rectify this issue as soon as possible. Please provide me with an updated statement reflecting the correct amount.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Best regards,
Ludwina Gerlach

08.title: Missing Overtime Payments - Multiple Employees
08.subject: Missing Overtime Payment
08.description: Multiple employees have reported missing overtime payments from their salary calculations.

emails.subject: Assistance Required with Overtime Payment for Last Month
emails.content:
Dear Tech Support Team,

I hope this message finds you well.

I am writing to seek your assistance regarding an issue with my salary payment for last month. Upon reviewing the amount credited to my account, I noticed that it only reflects my base salary and does not include the overtime payment I am entitled to.

Could you please look into this matter and help ensure that the overtime payment is processed correctly? Your attention to this issue would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you for your support.

Best regards,
Miss Schenk

emails.subject: Immediate Action Required: Missing Overtime Payment
emails.content:
Hi Tech Support Team,

I'm really frustrated right now. My salary for last month only includes my base pay and is missing the overtime I worked hard for. This is unacceptable, especially since I have a mortgage payment due in a few days.

I need this fixed immediately. Please process my overtime payment ASAP. This is urgent and can't wait.

Thanks,
Mr. Graf

09.title: Missing Salary
09.description:
I am extremely upset and disappointed to find that my salary is missing from my account this month. This situation has caused me significant harm and stress. I depend on my salary to cover essential expenses, and this oversight has left me in a precarious financial position.

I have bills to pay, and this delay has already resulted in late fees and penalties. The anxiety and frustration this has caused me are overwhelming, and I need this issue resolved immediately.

The harm caused by this negligence is both financial and emotional. As a dedicated employee, I expect my salary to be deposited on time. The lack of communication and urgency in addressing this issue is unacceptable.

**Demands:** I demand that my salary be deposited into my account without any further delay, and I expect a formal apology for the distress and inconvenience caused. If this issue is not resolved promptly, I will be forced to take further action.
